answers.answer: Is he the only dr. in that practice?  If not I would see another dr. because I have always heard if the bottom # is over 80 it is too high!  You need to be very carefull.  How many weeks are you?

It is a bit concerning.  How were your blood pressures before pregnancy?  Is the initial pressure high, and when they retake it, it is low?  ARE they retaking it?How many weeks are you? Sorry, I forgot if you said before.Spend as much time as you can laying on your side and resting.  I would be a good idea to get a home blood pressure monitor (you can pick these up at any drug store probably for around $25-30) and take it a couple times every day during a quiet time at home.There are some blood tests that are commonly done to gauge whether or not you are developing pre-eclampsia.  I surprised this isn't being done.

I am 23 w 4 d. I have been checking my blood pressure with a blood pressure monitor plus my mom is an EMT and takes it for me. The specialist I saw said that there was a problem with the vascularization of the placenta, and so the uterinplacenta blood flow is not good, which is creating the high blood pressure. So, when I got to my doctor after seeing the specialist, my doctor said that it was preexisting hypertension. He has been acting like that specialist didn't find a problem with the placenta and is convinved that I had high blood pressure before....Which is NOT true and I tried telling him that, but he seems to think he has it all figured out! So I have NO idea what to do. I think I am going ask to be refered to the specialist in Toledo for the remainder of my pregnancy so that i know that someone is paying attention!

That's a terrific idea.  Hypertension combined with decreased uteroplacental blood flow is something to be followed closely.   The decreased flow usually the result of severe gestional hypertension.Be firm and anticipate what you will do or say if he won't refer you.  Hopefully, you don't have to be referred.  If he won't refer you, consider finding another OB even at this late date.  A good doctor will always be willing to refer you if necessary.Please keep us updated!  Rest as much as possible.  Do you work?
I looked him up and can't find him. Can you try and find out his first name???

Hey....there is a great high risk doc in FW. His name is Dr. Walker and he delivers at Lutheran or Dupont. Does an u/s at every visit and can be seen with no referral. Check to see if he's taking people and if you super awesome insurance will cover him. I think you need to tell Erwin to get lost. Him being like this to you has ME freaking out about you and me both!  When I ever have my next one, I am going to get into this Dr. Walker. A life flight nurse who I know realllly well has delivered with him on several occassions and used him for her kids and she loves the man!
Thanks Jess! I am going to look him up and see if he takes my insurance.

I am a full time college student, but our semester ends this week, so my butt is leaving bed as little as possible. I will take his word with a grain of salt, and do what I know will help my blood pressure:) Hopefully everything turns out okay! Also, I am getting the test strips the doctor uses to test for protein in urine so that I can check it myself! It sucks having to be your own doctor, but when you can't rely on the one you have, you gotta do whatever you can!!!

I posted to your thread yesterday....I had preexisting hbp and my dr. monitored me carefully and gave me meds and increased them as needed...while your bp was not way way high yesterday, it is high enough to be concerned and I too would go to the specialist as he is taking your case more seriously and you feel better about the treatment you are receiving from him which is also important...good luck and keep us posted....

question: I went to the doctor today. All of my blood pressures for the last week have been about 140/90 or just over. My WONDERFUL doctor told me my blood pressure was fine, and he would see me in a week! Thats all he said! He didn't even ask me about the swelling at all, but I had told the nurse before he came in! He is seriously starting to scare me because he has so many patients, I don't think he remembers who anyone is....so of course, he probably forgets how high risk I am, and how the specialist I saw told me to be very cautious of every symptom. I am so stressed out by this whole situation! But thanks to all that gave advice on preeclampsia.
title: Preeclampsia Question Update
